<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Materials Science Co-op/Intern – Summer 2026</strong></p><p> </p><p>This job description reflects potential openings for the <strong>Summer 2026 Co-op/Internship</strong> Session (May - August). This is a general job description and represents multiple openings in various departments. <strong>Honda offers both single and multi-semester co-ops and internships. College students must apply to the requisition pertaining to their major and semester of interest</strong></p><p><strong>Please note: </strong>Sponsorship for employment visa status for these positions is unavailable. Applicants requiring sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future (e.g., F-1 CPT/OPT, H-1B, TN, etc.) will not be considered.</p><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>More about the Material Science Co-op/ Intern at Honda</strong></p><p> </p><p>The below descriptions reflect <em>potential</em> environments and duties within our various Material Science Co-op/ Intern positions that we offer. Work environments and projects may include but are not limited to</p><p> </p><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">Manufacturing (Casting, Paint, Product Engineering)</span><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none;">:</span></p><ul><li>Support mass production with failure analysis.</li><li>Support new model groups with new materials/processes qualification and specification testing.</li><li>Prepare samples for metallurgical evaluation - cutting, grinding, and polishing.</li><li>Perform metallurgical testing (metallographic, hardness testing, tensile/compression testing, etc.).</li><li>Summarize test results in report form and present investigation results.</li><li>Collection, organization, and analysis of data to develop improvement activity.</li></ul><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>What you need to be successful in this role</strong></p><p> </p><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">Required</span>:</p><ul type="disc"><li>Legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship</li><li>General Business Coursework</li><li>Minimum 2.5 Cumulative GPA or higher (You will be required to provide your current transcript)</li><li>Class status- Sophomore (by credit hour) or above</li><li>Availability to work a minimum of 10 weeks at 40 hours per week</li><li>Enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program studying Material Science or Metallurgical Engineering</li><li>Valid U.S. Driver's License (exceptions considered on a case-by-case basis)</li><li>Ability to secure own transportation to and from work each day<ul type="circle"><li><em>*Public transportation and ride share services are limited in some of our locations. Co-ops are responsible for securing their own transportation to and from work each day, and must have a reliable plan for transportation in order to be eligible for a position.</em><em> Regular in-person attendance is required, and transportation issues will not be excused.</em></li></ul></li></ul><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">Desired</span><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none;">:</span> Ferrous Metallurgy, Physical Metallurgy, Failure Analysis, Material Science or Metallurgy lab courses, Manufacturing related coursework</p><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Position Locations</strong></p><p> </p><p>Material Science Co-op/Intern positions are offered in the cities/ states listed below, if you are selected to move forward in the process, you will be given the opportunity to make selections on your location preferences:</p><ul><li>East Liberty, OH (55 minutes northwest of Columbus, Ohio)</li><li>Timmonsville, South Carolina (20 minutes southwest of Florence, South Carolina)</li><li>Raymond, OH (50 Minutes northwest of Columbus, Ohio)</li></ul><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Honda Co-operative and Learning Internships Program Benefits</strong></p><p> </p><p><strong>Housing Accommodations: </strong>Honda offers housing at a shared cost or a housing stipend based on location for our Co-ops and Interns. It is not required to opt-in to, but is available should you need housing at the time of your Co-op/ Internship with Honda.</p><p><strong>Honda Business Resource Groups</strong>: One of the ways Honda gives diversity a voice is through its business resource groups. The associate-led, company-supported groups have members aligned across different dimensions of diversity such as gender, ethnicity, ability, life stage and experiences. The groups provide networking opportunities, a chance to give back and professional development. Some groups have even given feedback on Honda products, making them more appealing to all. Embracing all views is what will drive us into the future. Honda wants passionate, driven people to be a part of that future.</p><p><strong>Performance Feedback:</strong> Honda Co-ops and Interns will have the opportunity to receive informal and formal feedback from their leaders, ask questions and express future interest in a scheduled mid-term and final evaluation.</p><p><strong>Mentorship: </strong>Each Co-op/ Intern is assigned a mentor in your department to help you navigate your time at Honda.</p><p><strong>On-site Wellness Center:</strong> Co-ops and Interns have access to join our Wellness Centers (varies by location). Our Wellness Centers are full gyms equipped with cardio machines, weights, basketball courts, pools, dieticians, personal trainers and group fitness classes.</p><p><strong>Paid overtime: </strong>Co-ops and Interns will receive 1.5 times their hourly rate of pay for any overtime worked.</p><p><strong>Consideration for full time employment: </strong>Our Cooperative Learning Internships program is utilized as a talent pipeline for our full time positions!</p><p><strong>Hourly Wage Range: </strong>$27.22-$35.22</p><p><em><strong>Pay will be based on several variables that include, but not limited to, geographic location, work experience, education, etc.</strong></em></p><p><em>Additional details regarding Honda Co-op and Intern benefits are provided upon offer.</em></p>

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>Health is everything. At CVS Health, colleagues are committed to increasing access, lowering costs, and improving quality of care. Millions of times a day, we help people on their path to better health –from advising on prescriptions to helping manage chronic and specialty conditions. As a 3rd year pharmacy intern, you have a significant role in our company working as a part of the pharmacy team– delivering our purpose, modeling our values, and demonstrating genuine, authentic care for our patients. </p><p></p><p>While working as a 3rd year pharmacy intern, under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, you play a critical role in ensuring a safe and effective Retail Pharmacy work environment that delivers exceptional care to each patient. This includes but is not limited to:</p><ul><li>Patient Safety</li><li>Pharmacy Professional Practice</li><li>Regulatory Requirements</li><li>Quality Assurance</li><li>Customer Service</li><li>Inventory Management</li><li>Workflow Management excluding final prescription verification</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Primary Roles and Responsibility: </b></p><p>A key component of the pharmacy intern role is keeping your customers and patients healthy through adoption and management of patient care programs. Additionally, you will:</p><ul><li>Lead with Heart – display empathy and compassion for your patients, customers, caregivers, and colleagues on your team</li><li>Seek new ways to grow, collaborate with others, and deliver better outcomes</li><li>Align others around our purpose to bring your heart to every moment of your health and gain support and commitment</li><li>Facilitate a team culture that promotes caring, energy, enthusiasm, and pride</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Education:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Required Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>0-3 years relevant work experience</li><li>Must possess or be in process of obtaining valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li><li>Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li>Complete all required training within state guidelines and required timeframe</li><li>Ability to:<ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Finger Dexterity: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Reach overhead; able to stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Precision control: able to adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Visual Acuity: Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Able to orally communicate information and instructions to colleagues and customers</li><li>Occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs; exerting up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects</li></ul></li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Ability To: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Complete any additional tasks as directed by supervisor or manager</li><li>Complete all required training and obtain required licensure (if applicable) within state guidelines</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Immunization eligibility</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.50 - $20.25<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/01/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

job_title: Studio Operations in Home Mastering Intern, Summer 2026
job_description:
About the Role & Program

Studio Operations in Home Mastering provides an extensive range of digital file-based solutions to support filmmaking, mastering, asset finishing, distribution, sound mixing, editorial suites, and theatre and screening facilities.

We are seeking a dedicated intern to join our Studio Operations in Home Mastering team for the summer term. The selected candidate will actively contribute to strategic projects encompassing all stages of the digital supply chain.

This internship is full-time and will be based in Burbank, CA, running from May 2026 through August 2026.

What You Will Do

Support the internal mastering workflow from order creation, fulfillment, and QC in the following ways:

  • Identify key operational metrics and develop corresponding models and dashboards.

  • Refine the process of collecting and managing scorecard metrics.

  • Continuously improve production tools and methodologies.

  • Gather and analyses user requirements for software enhancements.

  • Document and map existing workflows.

  • Administrative responsibilities include supporting work order creation, providing daily ad hoc assistance, and collecting requirements, assets, and deliverables.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Experienced with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).

  • Background in working with AI, video, and audio technologies.

  • Able to think strategically about end-to-end workflows, proposing and implementing improvements for operational efficiency.

  • Excels in fast-paced settings, maintains organization under pressure, and effectively manages multiple projects by prioritizing and adapting as required.

  • Holds prior experience in the entertainment industry.

Education

  • Junior or Senior year preferred

  • Major or previous coursework in Media, Cinema or Business-related

Eligibility Requirements & Program Information:

Candidates for this opportunity MUST meet all of the below requirements:

  • Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.

  • Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.

  • Be at least 18 years of age

  • Possess unrestricted work authorization

Additional Information:

  • Must provide full work availability from June through August 2026.

  • Must provide own housing and transportation, position is located in Burbank, CA.


The pay rate for this role in California is $22.50 per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

<p>JR-108335</p><p>Agency</p><p><br></p><p>Adult Correction</p><p>Division</p><p><br></p><p>Job Classification Title</p><p><br></p><p>Student Intern (S)</p><p>Position Number</p><p><br></p><p>Grade</p><p><br></p><p>PORT 12</p><p>About Us</p><p><br></p><p>The NC Department of Adult Correction is one of the largest state agencies with more than 14,000 employees. It is responsible for safeguarding and preserving lives and property through prevention, protection, and preparation as well as the care, custody, and supervision of all adults sentenced for violating North Carolina laws. This department includes state prisons with custody, healthcare, and facility operations staff as well as probation/parole officers who supervised sentenced people in the community. Other divisions include Administration, Health Services, Rehabilitation &amp; Reentry, Special Operations and the Post-Release Supervision &amp; Parole Commission. We have a mission that matters!</p><p><br></p><p>Description of Work</p><p><br></p><p>The NC Department of Adult Correction (NCDAC) Summer Internship Program offers a paid, 9–10-week experience designed to provide students with meaningful, hands-on exposure to public service and state government operations. Interns will contribute to mission-critical projects across multiple divisions, gaining practical skills in areas such as human resources, finance, purchasing, IT, communications, education services, and compliance.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>This program is ideal for students pursuing degrees in criminal justice, public administration, business, accounting, healthcare, IT, engineering, social work, and related fields.</p><p><br></p><p>Internship Opportunities May Include (but are not limited to):</p><p>• Human Resources &amp; Talent Acquisition</p><p>• Division of Institutions &amp; Services</p><p>• Controller’s Office</p><p>• Purchasing/Historically Underutilized Businesses (HUB)</p><p>• Information Technology &amp; Data Analytics</p><p>• Combined Records</p><p>• Special Operations Intelligence Telecommunications</p><p>• Support Services, Engineering, Facilities &amp; Maintenance</p><p>• Finance, Budget &amp; Business Operations</p><p>• Communications, Policy &amp; Research</p><p>• Reentry, Education &amp; Program Services</p><p>• Correction Enterprises</p><p>• Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA)</p><p>• Compliance, Inclusion &amp; Equity</p><p><br></p><p>The 30 selected interns will be matched to divisions based on academic background, interests, and departmental needs as well as your marked interest per application.</p><p>Knowledge Skills and Abilities/Management Preferences</p><p><br></p><p>Salary Range: $18.00 per hour</p><p><br></p><p>About the NCDAC Summer Internship Program&nbsp;</p><p>For more information about the internship program, please take a look at our website Internship Opportunities | NC DAC</p><p><br></p><p>How to Apply</p><p>Interested candidates should apply through State of NC Job Opportunities (Workday) and submit:</p><p><br></p><p>Submit an online application</p><p><br></p><p>Attach a current resume</p><p><br></p><p>Attach an Unofficial copies of transcripts from current attending school</p><p><br></p><p>(Optional) A brief statement of interest indicating preferred areas or divisions</p><p><br></p><p>Applications will be reviewed starting Feb. 21st. and on a rolling basis until all positions are filled.&nbsp;Further information and communications will be forthcoming.</p><p><br></p><p>The Posting Will Close At 11:59 P.M. The Night Before The End Date&nbsp;</p><p>All applicants must be able to work up to 35–40 hours per week for the entire 9–10-week internship period depending upon student and section availabilities.</p><p>Students should coordinate with their institution if seeking academic credit as our agency will be paying the student</p><p>Eligibility will be checked against DAC Standards (i.e., background, etc.)</p><p>Supplemental Contact Information&nbsp;</p><p>North Carolina Department of Adult Corrections (NCDAC) uses the Merit-Based Recruitment and Selection Plan to fill positions subject to the State Human Resources Act with the most qualified individuals. Hiring salary will be based on relevant qualifications, internal equity, and budgetary considerations pertinent to the advertised position. For more information about NCDAC, please visit us at our website.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Application Process&nbsp;</p><p>Be sure to complete the application in its entirety. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of completing this application.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Information should be provided in the appropriate areas, to include the following: Education, including high school and all degrees obtained, Work Experience, and Certificates &amp; Licenses. It is critical to our screening and salary determination process that applications contain comprehensive candidate information.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Answers to Supplemental Questions are not a substitute for providing all relevant information within the body of your application. To receive credit for the supplemental questions, you must provide supporting information within the "Work Experience" section of the application to support your answers.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>If multiple applications are submitted to an individual posting, only the most recent application received prior to the closing date will be accepted. Applications must be submitted by 11:59 PM on the night before closing date.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Applicants may be subject to a criminal background check.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>If applying for a position certified through the NC Dept. of Justice - Criminal Justice Standards Division, click this link for specific certification requirements:&nbsp;Correctional &amp; Probation/Parole Officer Certification.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>The NC Dept. of Adult Correction must adhere to the US Dept. of Justice Final Rule on the "National Standards to Prevent, Detect, and Respond to Prison Rape."&nbsp;Click this link for information on hiring and promotion prohibition requirements for all positions in the NC Dept. of Adult Correction: PREA Hiring and Promotion Prohibitions (Download PDF reader) (Download PDF reader).&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Due to the volume of applications received, we are unable to provide information regarding the status of your application over the phone. To check the status of your application, please log in to your account. The hiring process may take several weeks.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions. Transcripts and degree evaluations may be uploaded with your application. The State of North Carolina/Office of State Human Resources (OSHR) uses the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES) as a referral resource for applicants who need to have their credentials certified as equivalent.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>For a list of organizations that perform this specialized service, please visit the NACES membership website at https://www.naces.org/members.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Degree/College Credit Verification&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions. Transcripts, degree evaluations, and cover letters may be uploaded with your application.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Veterans’ and National Guard Preference&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Applicants seeking Veteran's Preference must attach a DD-214 Member-4 Form (Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty) to their applications.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Applicants seeking National Guard Preference must attach an NGB 23A (RPAS), along with the state application, if they are a current member of the NC National Guard in good standing.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Applicants who are former members of either the NC Army National Guard or the NC Air National Guard, with honorable discharge and six years of creditable service, must attach a copy of the DD 256 or NGB 22, along with the state application.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>ADA Accommodations&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act (PWFA), NCDAC is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, NCDAC will ensure that people with disabilities, or known limitations covered by the PWFA, are provided with reasonable accommodation. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact the person indicated below.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Minimum Education and Experience</p><p><br></p><p>Some state job postings say you can qualify by an “equivalent combination of education and experience.” If that language appears below, then you may qualify through EITHER years of education OR years of directly related experience, OR a combination of both. See the Education and Experience Equivalency Guide for details.</p><p><br></p><p>Must be a permanent North Carolina resident attending an accredited college, university, law school, community college, or technical institute in North Carolina (or a NC resident attending an equivalent institution out of state).</p><p><br></p><p>Community college students must have completed their first year completed before beginning the internship.</p><p><br></p><p>Applicants must be continuing their education in the fall following their participation in the program.</p><p><br></p><p>To qualify for a law internship, applicants must have completed at least one year of law school before the beginning of the internship, unless other majors are listed.</p><p><br></p><p>Students having previously held paid internships with this program are not eligible to apply- subject to exception approval.</p><p><br></p><p>Must be a junior or senior (associate’s, bachelor’s, or master’s level) with a minimum 2.0 GPA.</p><p><br></p><p>Must be at least 18 years old by January 1, 2026</p><p><br></p><p>Must be legally authorized to work in the United States and provide proof of identity and work authorization within three business days of employment.</p><p><br></p><p>EEO Statement</p><p><br></p><p>The State of North Carolina is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and dedicated to providing employees with a work environment free from all forms of unlawful employment discrimination, harassment, or retaliation. The state provides reasonable accommodation to employees and applicants with disabilities; known limitations related to pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; and for religious beliefs, observances, and practices.</p><p><br></p>

The Office of Senator Maria Cantwell is currently accepting applications for our paid spring press internship in Washington, D.C. This intern will work with the communications team under the guidance of the Communications Director. The team communicates with press and constituents about topics stretching across all issue portfolios, so an intern should be ready to quickly familiarize themselves with a broad range of subjects. Tasks may include, but are not limited to, tracking media coverage, drafting press materials and social media content, graphic design, assisting with organizing media events and prepping for hearings, and more. This position requires strong communication skills and attention to detail.

Washington state ties are strongly preferred. The internship will run from March - May 2026 (with some flexibility depending on interns’ school schedules). This position is full-time (30-40hrs/week), and may include remote work on mornings and weekends.

Interested applicants should submit their resume here. A cover letter is not required at this time. In lieu of a cover letter, candidates progressing to the next round will be asked to answer a few short questions. Please be sure to note in your resume any proficiencies in foreign languages and/or any video editing or graphic design skills.

To submit your application, please use the following link: https://sen.gov/RZ472

If you have any questions, please contact our office at internships@cantwell.senate.gov.

Job Description

About the Role

Uber's Strategic Finance team is uniquely positioned to have transparency into Uber's overall global business and to use financial & operational data to reach insights others might not be able to make. The team is responsible for working closely with cross-functional teams to support financial planning, tracking key financial metrics, driving efficiency, and making product and business recommendations.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to support one of our high growth businesses and use insights to help Uber prioritize initiatives and reach conclusions. As part of the summer program, your deliverable will be a business recommendation to the Strategic Finance Leadership team.

Pro Tip: Apply early-roles may close sooner than expected due to high demand.

What You'll Do
• Financial Planning: be part of the team that is responsible for financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis for Uber's global business
• Strategic Thinking: Apply business judgment and financial insights to assist with decision making related to new initiatives, products, and business opportunities
• Financial Modeling: Build intricate financial models from scratch, improve existing models, and break complex models down into component parts
• Operational Excellence: Lead initiatives that help us scale from startup to enterprise
Basic Qualifications
• Currently enrolled in a BS/BA program in Finance, Accounting, Economics or a similar field (graduation date Winter 2028 - Spring 2029)
• Basic knowledge of GAAP and experience with Excel/gSheets
• Minimum 1 year of involvement in extracurricular groups, activities, or internship opportunities
Preferred Qualifications
• Prior analytical internship experience in the technology industry, including FP&A, investment banking, management consulting or private equity
• Leadership positions in any extracurricular activities
• Proven understanding of GAAP, enterprise-level financial planning systems, SQL, and/or statistical software packages
• Outstanding analytical skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Ability to structure effective presentations
• Attention to detail and ability to execute in a fast paced environment
• Self-starter - you take initiative, set goals, and meet them
About the Team

We are a global and expansive team that excels at combining strategy and real numbers. We are leaders helping to set the financial and strategic direction of the company.

We are embedded in all the global businesses and functions of Uber, setting the financial plans and operating cadence. However, our work really begins when the plans are set. We proactively connect the dots, set the course, and help the company deliver on its goals!

We also don't just say how it is. We are members of the team that finds and implements the solutions to our biggest challenges.

For New York, NY-based roles: The base hourly rate amount for this role is USD$31.00 per hour.

You will also be eligible for various benefits.
Employment Type: OTHER

Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

Job Description:

Job Summary

Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine is seeking a Neuroscience Digital Health & Data Science Intern to support the Neuroscience Data Science and Digital Health organization within the Digital and AI Measures team. This internship provides hands‑on experience working with digital health technologies, neuroscience data, and analytics used in clinical and translational research.

The intern will support the evaluation, integration, and analysis of multimodal data sources—including speech‑based digital measures, imaging‑derived features, and clinical datasets—while collaborating with cross‑functional data science, clinical, and biomarker teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support cleaning, validation, and exploratory analysis of digital health and neuroscience datasets

  • Assist with data cleaning and evaluation of speech‑based and imaging‑derived digital measures used in clinical research

  • Contribute to development of analysis workflows and documentation under guidance of senior data scientists

  • Perform data quality checks and summarize findings through figures, tables, and presentations

  • Support literature review and benchmarking of digital health and AI‑enabled measurement approaches

  • Assist with documentation related to data handling and analytical processes and drafting the manuscript

Required Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in Undergraduate or Graduate program in Bioengineering, Neuroscience, Computational Biology and Data Science, Biomedical Engineering and Bioinformatics

  • Completion of at least two years of undergraduate study by internship start

  • Strong analytical and problem‑solving skills

  • Experience programming in Python for data analysis

  • Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non‑technical audiences

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience with biomedical, clinical, or digital health datasets

  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and basic statistical methods

  • Experience with additional tools such as R, Power BI, or data visualization libraries

  • Research or industry experience in neuroscience, bioengineering, or health technology

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to work in a collaborative, fast‑paced environment

Internship Details

  • Location: Remote

  • Travel: No travel expected

  • Hours: Full‑time (40 hours/week)

Equal Opportunity Statement

Permanently authorized to work in the U.S., must not require sponsorship of an employment visa (e.g., H-1B or green card) at the time of application or in the future. Students currently on CPT, OPT, or STEM OPT usually requires future sponsorship for long term employment and do not meet the requirements for this program unless eligible for an alternative long-term status that does not require company sponsorship.

Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.

Johnson & Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants’ needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, external applicants please contact us via https://www.jnj.com/contact-us/careers . Internal employees contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.

<p><b>WEX Inc.</b><span><b> </b>is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. These are skills that will accelerate any sales career.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><span><span style="font-size:14px"><b>Experience you'll bring:</b></span></span></p><ul><li><p><span>Preferred Location: Salt Lake City, Utah; or Nashville, TN for a hybrid work schedule.</span></p></li><li><p><span>At a minimum, you should be a rising Junior, or Senior in a degree/certificate-seeking accredited Bachelor's program.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong time management skills, including planning and execution.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting information.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong interpersonal and communication skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment, and a willingness to try new things.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work effectively under limited supervision. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Excel and Tableau Skills are a plus.</span><span> </span></p></li></ul><p></p><p></p>The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. <p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>At CVS Health, we are focused on transforming health care for our customers and making our company a great place to work. We help people navigate the health care system – and their personal health care – by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. Within our Retail locations, we bring this promise to life with heart every day. Our 3rd year Pharmacy Interns play a critical role in supporting our pharmacy teams to consistently deliver on our brand promise, while developing their own skills in preparation for increasing responsibility.</p><p></p><p>As a 3rd year Pharmacy Intern, you will be focused on applying didactic learning from pharmacy school into real-world practice to become ready for a Pharmacist role. Under the direction of your preceptor, you will complete a comprehensive training roadmap designed to show you first-hand what it’s like to be part of a pharmacy team while gaining an overview of store, district, and regional operations. You will gain valuable hands-on experience through a training roadmap that includes a combination of Key Learning Experiences (KLEs), activities, and time spent with leaders in your district. While in the pharmacy, you will assist the pharmacy team to ensure that pharmacy operations run smoothly, our patients’ prescriptions are filled promptly, safely, and accurately, and we are providing caring service that exceeds patient expectations. You will learn to operate as part of the pharmacy team through consistent application of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), best practices, and effective communication. Throughout your shifts and in all customer and colleague interactions, you will learn to demonstrate empathy and genuine care, and contribute to a safe and inclusive culture where all people feel valued and empowered.</p><p></p><p>3rd year Pharmacy Interns are responsible for completion of a comprehensive training roadmap, focusing on KLEs that build aptitude in the following areas. As tenure increases, 3rd year Pharmacy Interns take on increasing responsibility of the safety and effectiveness of operations in the pharmacy, including but not limited to: </p><p></p><ul><li>Living our purpose by following all company SOPs at each workstation to help our Pharmacists and Technicians manage and improve patient health</li><li>Following pharmacy workflow procedures at each pharmacy workstation (i.e., production, pick-up, drive-thru, and drop-off) for safe and accurate prescription fulfillment</li><li>Contributing to positive patient experiences showing empathy and genuine care: creating heartfelt and personalized moments while serving patients at pick-up, drive-thru, and over the phone; keeping patients healthy by offering immunizations and other services at the register and over the phone; and demonstrating compassionate care by solving or escalating patient problems</li><li>Offering to counsel, fielding medical questions, and soliciting information on a patient’s medical history to provide optimal care, when appropriate under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist</li><li>Taking telephonic prescriptions from the prescriber, and calling the prescriber to clarify prescriptions or facilitate medication changes, where allowed by state regulation</li><li>Maintaining the highest level of self-awareness and providing in-the-moment coaching, training, and mentoring to pharmacy team members while sharing best practices</li><li>Completing basic inventory activities, as permitted by law, and as directed by the pharmacy leadership team, such as accurately putting away medication deliveries and completing cycle counts, returns-to-stocks, waiting bin inventories, etc.</li><li>Contributing to a high-performing team, embracing a growth mindset, and being receptive to feedback; actively seeking opportunities to expand clinical and technical knowledge needed to better assist patients</li><li>Remaining flexible for both scheduling and business needs, while contributing to a safe, inclusive, and engaging team dynamic; voluntarily traveling to stores in the market to work shifts as needed by the business</li><li>Understanding and complying with all relevant federal, state, and local laws, regulations, professional standards, and ethical principles. Complying with CVS policies and procedures to ensure patient safety, compliance with controlled substance dispensing and recordkeeping, and to protect patient privacy and security</li><li>Delivering additional patient health care services (e.g., immunizations, point-of-care testing, and voluntarily staffing offsite clinics), where allowable by law and supported by required training and certification</li></ul><p></p><p>Where permissible, the 3rd year Pharmacy Intern may also support immunizations, which includes the following responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Completing additional licensure and training requirements, in compliance with state Board of Pharmacy regulations, to obtain Technician Immunizer status to support preparing and administering vaccines</li><li>Educating patients about the importance of vaccines and referring patients to the Pharmacist-on-duty for vaccination questions</li><li>Monitoring for, and responding to, adverse reactions; reporting adverse reaction events per public health requirements</li><li>Reviewing and collecting patient information; tracking and documenting for each applicable patient</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications:</b></p><ul><li>Accepted into, or actively enrolled in, an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>Must possess, or be in the process of obtaining, valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Essential Functions:</b></p><ul><li>Regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Ability to complete required training within designated timeframe</li><li>Attention and Focus:<ul><li>Ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time</li><li>Ability to pivot quickly from one task to another to meet patient and business needs</li><li>Ability to confirm prescription information and label accuracy, ensuring patient safety</li></ul></li><li>Customer Service and Team Orientation:<ul><li>Actively look for ways to help people, and do so in a friendly manner</li><li>Notice and understand patients’ reactions, and respond appropriately</li></ul></li><li>Communication Skills:<ul><li>Use and understand verbal and written communication to interact with patients and colleagues</li><li>Utilize active listening by giving full attention to what others are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times</li></ul></li><li>Mathematical Reasoning:<ul><li>Ability to use math to solve a problem, such as determining the total number of tablets to dispense, day’s supply, and/or number of full bottles and additional bottles needed to fill a prescription</li></ul></li><li>Problem Resolution:<ul><li>Identifying challenging patient or colleague interactions and choosing the best course of action when faced multiple options</li></ul></li><li>Physical Demands:<ul><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Reach overhead; stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Move fingers repetitively; picking, pinching, typing, or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Control precision; quickly adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree, requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Occasionally lift of up to 20 lbs and/or exert up to 20 lbs. of force; Frequently lift of up to 10 lbs and/or exert up to 10 lbs. of force; Consistently lift and/or exert a negligible amount of force to move information through oral communication</li></ul></li><li>Any additional tasks as directed by Supervisor or Manager</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Preferred Qualifications: </b></p><ul><li>1+ years of related work experience in pharmacy, retail, medical, or customer service setting</li><li>Ability to become immunization certified: Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li><li>Ability to work in home store, and across the market in other locations, to meet business needs</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.50 - $20.25<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/31/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

<p>Ready to shape the future of food?</p> <p>Join Butterball, America's favorite turkey brand, for an exciting summer internship! Butterball, LLC, is one of America's most iconic brands and the most loved and trusted brand of turkey in the United States. Known for helping consumers celebrate Thanksgiving, Butterball also brings delicious turkey products to tables around the world every day. Located in the thriving Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina area, our business model gives us the opportunity to provide a diverse array of career opportunities and paths which include live operations, processing facilities, corporate functions, and support offices. At Butterball, we aim to provide great-tasting foods that bring people together and inspire meaningful moments with the people who matter most.</p> <p>Over the course of 10-12 weeks, as an IT Site Admin Intern, you'll work in Carthage, MO or Huntsville, AR. This internship's goal will be to identify a technology-based improvement opportunity and devise and manage the project plan for implementation. This could entail a brand-new project or building from an existing project. The program's primary objective is to grow future leaders by providing professional development, and a series of assignments that aligns with professional interest within the processing and manufacturing industry.</p> <p>What you'll do:</p> <ul> <li>On-site process evaluation with operations groups to identify a need for technology-based improvement.</li> <li>Collaborate with internal and external teams to identify the best possible solution to said challenge.</li> <li>Submit a project proposal, build, and manage the project using our project management tool, Smartsheet.</li> <li>Projects may range from digitizing current paper processes, creating SOP documents, calculating ROI for current or potential opportunities, implementing new or current software to create more efficient processes for our operations teams, as well as other projects not yet discovered. </li> <li>Collaborate with multiple departments throughout Butterball, including CI, Manufacturing, Maintenance, Engineering, Live Operations, IT, and corporate support groups.</li> </ul> <p>What you'll get:</p> <ul> <li>Hands-on experience and professional development.</li> <li>Opportunities to network and learn from industry experts.</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits.</li> </ul> <p>We're looking for awesome students like you! </p> <p>Do you have a knack for problem-solving and a passion for food? We're looking for creative minds who can help us make our food production process even better. You'll need to be a team player, ready to roll up your sleeves and get things done. Think you have what it takes to make a delicious difference?</p> <p>Additional eligibility requirements: ?</p> <ul> <li>Pursuing a Bachelors in Information Technology, Data Analytics, Business, Engineering or related field with an expected graduation date of December 2026 through June 2027.</li> <li>All participants in this program are required to have a valid drivers license and reliable transportation to and from work.</li> <li>There will be frequent travel to our plants and live operation locations depending on project needs.</li> <li>The individual in this role will be required to initiate, lead, and follow through on conversations, presentations, and training, and should be comfortable with public speaking.</li> <li>This role requires a balance of technical, analytical thinking as well as being personable and able to make connections to further implement change on an enterprise level.</li> <li>Strong business acumen - ability to understand the impact of IT on different parts of the business.</li> </ul>

Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Upon joining our team you will be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence, and build incredible products that provide critical national capabilities. One day the world may hear the full story of your achievements and discover the critical role you’ve contributed to defend America.

As a Launch System Integrator - Intern, you will provide technical support and direction while working with teams on cross-level multidisciplinary product development teams. You will support core systems engineering activities, verification activities, and serve as a liaison between government customers and launch vehicle contractors. This role also provides responsibility for coordinating integrated ground operations, rehearsal planning, and flight operations support. The internship offers hands on exposure to end to end launch operations and the opportunity to work alongside engineers on high impact missions.

• Support the development of Launch Vehicle Requirements and review verification.
Conduct trade studies, risk assessments, and configuration management.
• Coordinate verification activities across internal teams and external partners.
• Support all working group meetings, technical exchange meetings and readiness reviews.
• Provide integration, coordination, and technical support to integrate a Satellite Vehicle onto a Launch Vehicle system which includes LV/SV interfaces, environments, launch facilities, communications and transportation
• Interface with flight operations SMEs to coordinate insertion orbits and compliance to requirements. Serve as a point of contact for day to day communications with government customers and launch vehicle contractors (e.g., SpaceX, ULA).
• Attend and contribute to various Working Groups and other stakeholder meetings.
• Coordinate electrical compatibility reviews, ensuring power, grounding, and data interface requirements are met.
• Work with electrical engineering teams to resolve interface mismatches .
Basic Qualifications:
• Student pursuing Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace Engineering or related field from an accredited college, or equivalent experience/combined education.
• Ability to travel 20% of the time, including extended travel.
• Strong interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain strong internal and external customer relationships.
• Ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance.
Desired Skills:
• Experience supporting execution of test events, evaluation of results, and development of verification reports to ensure requirement compliance.
• Demonstrated experience in performing technical studies and system trades for enhanced capabilities.
• Ability to coordinate with and interface with numerous customers, be proficient at delivering technical briefings.
• Current Top Secret/SCI security clearance
Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
Clearance Level: TS/SCI w/Poly

Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.

These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.

job_description: RELOCATION ASSISTANCE: Relocation assistance may be available<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>CLEARANCE TYPE: None<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>TRAVEL: No<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h2><b>Description</b></h2><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people&#39;s lives around the world today and for generations to come. Our pioneering and innovative spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation&#39;s history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage, and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, but they’re also making history.</p><p></p><p>An internship at Northrop Grumman is unique. You will learn new skills, explore our enterprise, network with experts, connect with thought leaders, and finish with a resume that opens doors. Join us and launch your career! We’ll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of advancing human discovery. In addition, you will gain experience in executive presence, technical leadership, mentoring, and coaching.</p><p></p><p><b>Northrop Grumman is seeking an undergraduate or graduate student in a STEM Field for an internship opportunity.</b> This position will be located in Rolling Meadows, IL. The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Space Systems Sector. </p><p></p><p><b>Basic Qualifications</b></p><p><b>A candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:</b></p><ul><li><p>Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing a bachelor’s/master&#39;s degree or higher from an accredited college/university and will be enrolled full time in Fall 2026</p></li><li><p>Be majoring in or having majored in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) degree.</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Be available to work full-time on-site (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during <b>summer 2026</b></p></li><li><p>Be a U.S. citizen</p></li></ul><p><b>Preferred Qualifications:</b></p><ul><li><p>Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.7 out of 4.0 or higher</p></li><li><p>Previous internship/co-op experience, leadership &amp; teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular).</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Intern Pay Range:</b></p><p>Bachelor’s: $24.75 to $30.25 per hour</p><p>Master’s: $35.50 to $38.25 per hour</p><p>At Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.</p><h3></h3><p>For broader consideration, please consider completing a profile in our campus candidate community. By clicking on the link below your resume will be visible to recruiters and hiring managers across Northrop Grumman with opportunities nationwide for our internship and entry-level positions:</p><p></p><p><a href="https://northropgrumman.yello.co/app/collect/form/9iuA6_W8E7bMDHTOHUZoWw" target="_blank">Northrop Grumman | Share Your Information</a></p>The application period for the job is estimated to be 20 days from the job posting date. However, this timeline may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>Northrop Grumman is an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO and pay transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for all positions with a government clearance and certain other restricted positions.

occurs in the month of <b>March 2026.</b></li><li>Selections will be made the week in the <b>beginning of April 2026.</b></li><li>Summer Internship Program will run from <b>Tuesday, May 26 to Friday, August 14, 2026</b> (12-weeks).</li></ul><p><b>Education Qualifications</b></p><ul><li>High School Diploma / GED Required</li><li>Associate's Degree Preferred</li><li>Bachelor's Degree Preferred</li></ul><p><b>Experience</b></p><ul><li>Must be currently attending a college, university or graduated within the past year. As a condition of employment, CHOP employees who work in patient care buildings or who have patient facing responsibilities must receive an annual influenza vaccine. <a href="https://careers.chop.edu/us/en/how-we-hire" target="_blank">Learn more.</a><br /><br /><a href="https://careers.chop.edu/us/en/eeo" target="_blank">EEO / VEVRAA Federal Contractor</a> | <a href="https://careers.chop.edu/us/en/tobacco-statement" target="_blank"> Tobacco Statement </a></b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>SALARY RANGE:</b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>$1.00 - $18.00 Hourly<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Salary ranges are shown for full-time jobs. If you're working part-time, your pay will be adjusted accordingly.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit">-------------------</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">At CHOP, we are committed to fair and transparent pay practices. job_title: Disney Entertainment Software Engineering Intern, Summer 2026
job_description:
About the Role & Program:

Do you remember seeing ads for Lilo and Stitch earlier last summer? What about Tron: Ares or Predator: Badlands in the Fall? If you did, it was likely because of the detailed planning and execution of the Disney Entertainment Media and Marketing team…and if you didn’t – it’s probably because our targeting is that good.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to join the Performance Marketing arm of this media team in Summer 2026. We are an integrated, cross-functional team of marketers, software engineers, data scientists, and analysts who help the Media team execute highly data-driven marketing campaigns for theatrical, streaming, and brand campaigns.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will contribute to our growing technology portfolio: innovative campaign planning tools, complex data science workflows, and elegant web applications that blend the art of advertising at Disney with the science of our data-backed insights.

This role is unique – our team is embedded directly within the Disney marketing organization. We're aligned and mission-driven, with the freedom to move fast and innovate to achieve our goals. You'll tackle the challenges of executing a precise paid media strategy, using the latest technologies and tools in the data/tech space. If you're excited about this, please get in touch – we'd love to hear from you!

What You Will Do:

  • Write code, fix bugs, and contribute to the development of a suite of tools used by the Performance Marketing group to execute on theatrical, streaming, and brand campaigns
  • Build and expand on backend services that automate and facilitate the execution of data-driven media campaigns on third party ad platforms
  • Collaborate with the broader team of media/marketing experts to rapidly iterate from prototypes to high-quality, production pipelines
  • Implement quality controls, monitoring, and other safeguards to ensure optimizations are accurately and safely applied to in-flight ad campaigns and key business metrics are always presented accurately

Required Qualifications & Skills:

  • Experience with building applications or services using Python, Java, or similar
  • Demonstrated ability to build any technical component in a larger system (e.g. microservice, API endpoint) as well as a deep understanding of the overall system architecture
  • Exceptional hands-on experience and strong core engineering skills — whether through internships, personal projects, or academic work
  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g. Git, GitHub/GitLab) and standard software development lifecycle tools (e.g. CI/CD pipelines)

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

  • Experience with Spark or SQL
  • Understanding of cloud compute (AWS, GCM, etc) and modern dev ops practices; understanding of CI/CD automation
  • Knowledge of ad platforms including DMPs, Google Ads, Facebook/Instagram, Innovid, LiveRamp and DSPs (Google DV360, Trade Desk, Verizon Media Group)

Education:

  • Junior or Senior year preferred
  • Major or significant coursework in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software, Electrical or Electronics Engineering, or comparable field of study

Eligibility Requirements & Program Information:

  • Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program AND returning to school the semester/quarter following the internship OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.
  • Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.
  • Be at least 18 years of age
  • Possess unrestricted work authorization


The pay rate for this role in Burbank is $42.00 per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

Want to accelerate your career? Join a team of driven people, performing with purpose.

At Avis Budget Group, we are proud to be a performance driven organization. Our 21,000+ employees encourage each other to be at their best through outstanding leadership, training and tools and rewards.

As a participant of our ABG Accelerate internship program you will be encouraged to explore different areas of our business to grow both personally and professionally to jump start a rewarding career.

The 10 Week Accelerate Internship Program consists of:

  • Learning the ins and outs of your department
  • Professional development workshops
  • Hear from our leaders to learn more about our business
  • Network with our senior leadership team
  • Visit our field operations to learn how your team influences our daily operations

What you'll do

  • Build new applications/tools/systems system for business critical operations

  • Engage with users to iteratively refine solutions, quickly test ideas, and build upon feedback

What we’re looking for:

  • Expected Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Operations Research, Physics

  • Programming experience with languages such as Python, Java, TypeScript/JavaScript and a strong understanding of object oriented programming concepts

  • Experience building applications to efficiently collect, manage, and process large data sets for analytics, ensuring fast performance and user-friendly interfaces

  • Comfortable in a fast-paced, high-demand environment with ever-evolving objectives

  • Strong collaboration skills, working effectively with both technical and non-technical teams.

  • Experience in a customer-facing environment, with proven ability to engage and collaborate with stakeholders outside of your immediate team

  • Experience years of experience with RESTful Web services (preferred)

  • Experience with progressive and responsive web design (preferred)

  • Knowledge of SQL and hands-on experience with MySQL databases (preferred)

The hourly rate for this position is $30 an hour.

Who we are:

Here at Avis Budget Group, you will be joining a team of 25,000 driven people, performing with purpose. Together, we’re moving the future of transportation forward with our innovative, customer-focused solutions.

Our culture is performance driven, where we encourage and support each other to be at our best through leadership, training, tools, and rewards.

We are proud to make a positive difference to the lives of our colleagues, customers, and communities where we operate.

Avis Budget Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other category protected by applicable law.

This advertisement does not constitute a promise or guarantee of employment. This advertisement describes the general nature and level of this position only. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. The compensation and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law. This position may be with any affiliate of Avis Budget Group.
