job_title: Summer 2026 Context Engineer, AI ChatBot Internship
job_description:
T-Mobile is synonymous with innovation–and you could be part of the team that disrupted an entire industry! We reinvented customer service, brought real 5G to the nation, and now we’re shaping the future of technology in wireless and beyond. Our work is as exciting as it is rewarding, so consider the career opportunity below as your invitation to grow with us, make big things happen with us, above all, #BEYOU with us. Together, we won’t stop!

Get hands-on experience, training—and a leg up on a bright future.

Learn. Achieve. Build a career.

T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and redefining the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way!

This is an 11-week paid learning experience during which you’ll be able to connect and network with other interns and leaders within the company. We invite you to come innovate with mentors who will challenge you to develop meaningful skills. You’ll contribute your creativity and outstanding ideas, while working alongside T-Mobile employees. We’ll give you hands-on projects and the chance to create an immediate impact.

What It's Like

Our team builds and evolves InsightBot, an in-house AI chatbot designed to improve how employees access insights, data, and institutional knowledge across T-Mobile. We focus on transforming complex processes—such as onboarding, access requests, and day-to-day operational questions—into intuitive, self-service AI experiences. By partnering closely with leadership, data teams, and platform owners, we reduce friction, speed up productivity, and scale knowledge that would otherwise live in silos. Our work directly impacts employee efficiency, onboarding speed, and the overall adoption of AI-driven ways of working at T-Mobile.

What You'll Do

The intern will work on expanding InsightBot’s Onboarding Help capabilities by partnering with leadership teams to understand how new employees are onboarded across the organization. They will conduct interviews, document onboarding processes, access requirements, and collaboration models, and translate that information into structured context for our in-house AI chatbot. The intern will apply context and prompt engineering techniques to improve how InsightBot answers real onboarding questions. Their work will directly improve new-hire productivity, reduce onboarding friction, and help establish a scalable, AI-driven onboarding experience at T-Mobile.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct interviews with leadership and team members to gather onboarding requirements, workflows, and access needs.
  • Create clear, standardized onboarding documentation including team overviews, access guides, and step-by-step permission processes.
  • Translate onboarding knowledge into structured context and prompt designs for the InsightBot AI chatbot.
  • Test, refine, and improve InsightBot’s onboarding responses using real-world onboarding scenarios.
  • Partner with product, data, and platform stakeholders to ensure onboarding guidance is accurate, scalable, and easy to maintain.

What It Takes

  • Coursework or hands-on experience in AI, machine learning, prompt engineering, conversational AI, or knowledge management.
  • Experience documenting processes, onboarding workflows, or operational playbooks in an enterprise environment.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to structure ambiguous information into clear guidance.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience working across technical and non-technical teams.

Minimum Qualifications

  • At least 18 years of age
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States
  • Must be actively enrolled in a Bachelors or Graduate degree program
  • Employees of T-Mobile or Metro by T-Mobile are ineligible for Internships

Employer does not sponsor work visas for this position. Note that this also applies to individuals who are students in F-1 status who desire sponsorship after they complete their education.

Relocation assistance may be provided to program participants who reside more than 50 miles from the internship location.

Intern wages range from $26/hour to $47/hour. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on education/STEM vs non-STEM designation.

Never stop growing!
As part of the T-Mobile team, you know the Un-carrier doesn’t have a corporate ladder–it’s more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it’s that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward. By applying for this career opportunity, you’re living our values while investing in your career growth–and we applaud it. You’re unstoppable!

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

Talent comes in all forms at the Un-carrier. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. Please note, this contact channel is not a means to apply for or inquire about a position and we are unable to respond to non-accommodation related requests.

<p><b>WEX Inc.</b> is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. Our purpose is simple: to reduce administrative burdens, streamline payments, and manage mobility.</p><p></p><p>With a team of over 7,200 professionals across 16 countries. Our specialties are <b>employee benefits, business payments, and fleet/mobility solutions</b>. We support more than 20 million SaaS accounts, 8 million Health Savings Accounts, and 19+ million vehicles worldwide. We're a growing company with a history of innovation and a focus on our customers, making this a great place to grow your career.</p><p></p><p><b>The WEX Summer Internship Program: Learn, Lead, and Make an Impact</b><br />Our 13-week paid internship program, running from late May to mid-August, is a chance for you to gain real-world experience and develop your skills. Recruiting begins in January and continues through March at our various locations across the U.S.</p><p></p><p>You won't just be a bystander; you'll work on impactful projects and contribute to WEX’s mission. We provide mentorship, professional development, and weekly learning experiences to help you build confidence and leadership skills. High-performing interns may even get the chance to lead their own initiatives.</p><p></p><p>We offer remote, hybrid, and onsite options for flexibility, and our goal is to bring top interns back full-time or offer them extended roles during the school year. Imagine starting your career with a company that’s building what's next. Your future starts here.</p><p></p><p><b>About the Team/Role:</b></p><p>The Risk Solutions group designs, deploys, and maintains machine learning and artificial intelligence models, and we are a key function to enable WEX’s strategic objectives. The team uses advanced methodologies, a wide range of data types, and modern technologies to identify and manage credit risk, protect our clients from fraud, and help assist the business through predictive insights. As such, you will not only be working with cutting-edge techniques for machine learning and artificial intelligence, you will also support important real-world applications to drive predictive insights for decision-making. </p><p></p><p>Who You Are:</p><p><span>You are a motivated and curious individual with a passion for data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. You enjoy learning new things, diving into complex problems, using data tools, code, and algorithms to apply. You enjoy working as a part of a team with partners that openly share perspectives.</span></p><p></p><p><b><span>How You'll Make an Impact:</span></b></p><ul><li><p><span>Learn side-by-side from experienced data scientists to mentor and guide you through hands-on projects.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Understand applications of data science and machine learning in the domains of fintech and financial services.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Build code to extract data, test and train machine learning models, and assess model performance. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Learn emerging trends in machine learning and identify opportunities for their applications.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Synthesize findings into actionable insights and tailor conclusions to stakeholders of various backgrounds.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Understand how machine learning projects are managed to drive a clear path to production and measurable impact</span>.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><span>Experience You’ll Bring:</span></b></p><ul><li><p><span>Currently enrolled in a Master’s program or a rising senior in a Bachelor’s program in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or other related domain. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong foundational knowledge of Python for data science and analytics through hands-on projects in coursework or self-study.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Understanding of common machine learning approaches in regression and classification, as well as common performance diagnostics.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Adaptable and comfortable working collaboratively and independently.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p></p><p></p>The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. Actual pay rates will vary and will be based on various factors, such as your qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. Base pay is one component of WEX's total compensation package. Most sales positions are eligible for commission under the terms of an applicable plan. Non-sales roles are typically eligible for a quarterly or annual bonus based on their role and applicable plan. WEX's comprehensive and market competitive benefits are designed to support your personal and professional well-being. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurances, retirement savings plan, paid time off, health savings account, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, and more. For more information, check out the "About Us" section.<p></p><p></p>Pay Range: $25.00 - $30.00

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>At CVS Health, we are focused on transforming health care for our customers and making our company a great place to work. We help people navigate the health care system – and their personal health care – by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. Within our Retail locations, we bring this promise to life with heart every day. Our 3rd year Pharmacy Interns play a critical role in supporting our pharmacy teams to consistently deliver on our brand promise, while developing their own skills in preparation for increasing responsibility.</p><p></p><p>As a 3rd year Pharmacy Intern, you will be focused on applying didactic learning from pharmacy school into real-world practice to become ready for a Pharmacist role. Under the direction of your preceptor, you will complete a comprehensive training roadmap designed to show you first-hand what it’s like to be part of a pharmacy team while gaining an overview of store, district, and regional operations. You will gain valuable hands-on experience through a training roadmap that includes a combination of Key Learning Experiences (KLEs), activities, and time spent with leaders in your district. While in the pharmacy, you will assist the pharmacy team to ensure that pharmacy operations run smoothly, our patients’ prescriptions are filled promptly, safely, and accurately, and we are providing caring service that exceeds patient expectations. You will learn to operate as part of the pharmacy team through consistent application of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), best practices, and effective communication. Throughout your shifts and in all customer and colleague interactions, you will learn to demonstrate empathy and genuine care, and contribute to a safe and inclusive culture where all people feel valued and empowered.</p><p></p><p>3rd year Pharmacy Interns are responsible for completion of a comprehensive training roadmap, focusing on KLEs that build aptitude in the following areas. As tenure increases, 3rd year Pharmacy Interns take on increasing responsibility of the safety and effectiveness of operations in the pharmacy, including but not limited to: </p><p></p><ul><li>Living our purpose by following all company SOPs at each workstation to help our Pharmacists and Technicians manage and improve patient health</li><li>Following pharmacy workflow procedures at each pharmacy workstation (i.e., production, pick-up, drive-thru, and drop-off) for safe and accurate prescription fulfillment</li><li>Contributing to positive patient experiences showing empathy and genuine care: creating heartfelt and personalized moments while serving patients at pick-up, drive-thru, and over the phone; keeping patients healthy by offering immunizations and other services at the register and over the phone; and demonstrating compassionate care by solving or escalating patient problems</li><li>Offering to counsel, fielding medical questions, and soliciting information on a patient’s medical history to provide optimal care, when appropriate under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist</li><li>Taking telephonic prescriptions from the prescriber, and calling the prescriber to clarify prescriptions or facilitate medication changes, where allowed by state regulation</li><li>Maintaining the highest level of self-awareness and providing in-the-moment coaching, training, and mentoring to pharmacy team members while sharing best practices</li><li>Completing basic inventory activities, as permitted by law, and as directed by the pharmacy leadership team, such as accurately putting away medication deliveries and completing cycle counts, returns-to-stocks, waiting bin inventories, etc.</li><li>Contributing to a high-performing team, embracing a growth mindset, and being receptive to feedback; actively seeking opportunities to expand clinical and technical knowledge needed to better assist patients</li><li>Remaining flexible for both scheduling and business needs, while contributing to a safe, inclusive, and engaging team dynamic; voluntarily traveling to stores in the market to work shifts as needed by the business</li><li>Understanding and complying with all relevant federal, state, and local laws, regulations, professional standards, and ethical principles. Complying with CVS policies and procedures to ensure patient safety, compliance with controlled substance dispensing and recordkeeping, and to protect patient privacy and security</li><li>Delivering additional patient health care services (e.g., immunizations, point-of-care testing, and voluntarily staffing offsite clinics), where allowable by law and supported by required training and certification</li></ul><p></p><p>Where permissible, the 3rd year Pharmacy Intern may also support immunizations, which includes the following responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Completing additional Temporary employees working 20+ hours per week are eligible for medical benefits, the employee assistance program, and business travel accident insurance.<br></br></br><b>About BAE Systems Platforms & Services </b></br>BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.<br><br>The Platforms & Services (P&S) sector under BAE Systems, Inc does the big stuff: the armored combat vehicles, naval guns, missile launchers, and naval ship repair…just to name a few. Our employees take pride in the work they do and why they do it. They are on the front lines every day, building our products to protect the lives of those who serve. We may be biased, but we think P&S does some of the coolest work around, and we think you will too.<br><br>This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.

<p style=\"text-align:left\"><b>Date Posted:</b></p>2026-02-03<p style=\"text-align:left\"><b>Country:</b></p>United States of America<p style="text-align:left"><b>Location:</b></p>US-RI-MIDDLETOWN-201 127 John Clarke Rd BBN MIDDLETOWN, Ste 3<p style="text-align:left"><b>Position Role Type:</b></p>Onsite<p><b><span>U.S. Citizen, U.S. Person, or Immigration Status Requirements:</span> </b></p>Active and transferable U.S. government issued security clearance is required prior to start date.​ U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance​<p><b>Security Clearance Type: </b></p>DoD Clearance: Secret<p><b>Security Clearance Status: </b></p>Active and existing security clearance required after day 1<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Who We Are At </b></p><p>RTX BBN Technologies we invent new science by applying radical cross-disciplinary techniques to prototype systems in order to prove concept viability. This is especially evident in our Physical Systems and Sciences group, located in Middletown/Newport, Rhode Island, where scientists and engineers anticipate the future in both very large and very small-scale scientific systems that often need to survive challenging operational environments.</p><p></p><p><b>What You Will Do & Learn </b></p><p>We are seeking qualified and eager interns to become an integral part of this work. You will join a project team designing, analyzing, and prototyping innovative multi-domain system architectures.</p><p></p><p>You will contribute to creating new algorithms and paradigms in critical areas such as positioning, navigation and timing, communication and networking, and detection and classification within extremely harsh or hostile environments. You will learn strategies for both free form thinking and disciplined application. You will hone your oral and written presentation skills. You will work with extraordinarily skilled team members, from project leadership to fellow interns.</p><p></p><p><b>Qualifications You Must Have</b></p><ul><li><p>Requires a High School Diploma or equivalent and student must be pursuing a bachelor’s or advanced degree in an applicable discipline (i.e. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field)</p></li><li><p>The ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. government issued security clearance is required. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.</p><p></p><p></p><div><p><span><span>Applications are accepted until further notice. </span></span><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><span><span>Please </span><span>note</span><span> this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens. </span></span><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b>Meet the Team</b></p><p>Orchestration and Automation is now a key part of any technology and in our organization, we bridge the gap between what products do and customers need. As Software Consulting Engineer Intern, you will work directly with your Manager and Mentor to gain hands on experience of developing software solutions for customers using Cisco Secure Development Lifecycle processes, across different Cisco technologies. You will have the opportunity to participate in one or more projects, and interact with customers, Software Architects, Delivery Engineers, Managers and Cisco Customer Experience (CX) Leadership.</p><p></p><p><b>Your Impact</b></p><p>During the program you will participate in day-to-day delivery activities such as coding, customer meetings, deliverable creation, building labs, DevOps, deployment, and troubleshooting. You will have the opportunity to leverage your coursework and experience in real-world scenarios as a full stack developer. You will likely gather experience in:</p><p></p><p>· Java, Gradle, Spring, Python, Ansible</p><p>· Automated unit testing, linting and builds</p><p>· Web development / VueJS / REST / SOAP / Web Sockets</p><p>· Engineering practices in git and DevOps</p><p>· Deployment and Support models</p><p></p><p><b>Minimum Qualifications</b></p><p>· Currently enrolled in a certification program (e.g., Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College), or currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program. Relevant fields include: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or related technical fields</p><p>· Ability to demonstrate an understanding of computer science fundamentals, including data structures and algorithms.</p><p>· Development experience using Python, Java, Spring/Spring Boot, JUnit tests.</p><p>· Proficiency in SQL and relational database concepts</p><p>· Experience with UNIX, Linux and Windows Operating Systems.</p><p></p><p><b>Preferred Qualifications</b></p><p>· Strong communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment</p><p>· Demonstrated curiosity and a desire to tackle and solve complex problems</p><p>· Experience in automation frameworks like Ansible</p><p>· Non-academic coding experience (i.e. hack-a-thons, code challenges, personal projects, GitHub, Open Source, volunteer coding experience, conference participation, etc.)</p><p>· Familiarity with AI tools is a plus but not a primary requirement</p><p>· Any certification such as CCNA, CCNP, Oracle, Red Hat Linux, Java, etc</p></div><p></p><h1>Why Cisco? </h1><p>At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.</p><p>Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere. </p><p>We are Cisco, and our power starts with you. </p><p></p><h1>Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S. and/or Canada:</h1><p></p><p>Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location, market conditions, job-related skillset, experience, qualifications, education, certifications, and/or training. The full salary range for certain locations is listed below. For locations not listed below, the recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.</p><p></p><p>U.S. employees are offered benefits, subject to Cisco’s plan eligibility rules, which include medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, paid parental leave, short and long-term disability coverage, and basic life insurance. Please see the Cisco careers site to discover more benefits and perks. Employees may be eligible to receive grants of Cisco restricted stock units, which vest following continued employment with Cisco for defined periods of time.</p><p></p><p>U.S. employees are eligible for paid time away as described below, subject to Cisco’s policies:</p><ul><li><p>10 paid holidays per full calendar year, plus 1 floating holiday for non-exempt employees</p></li><li><p>1 paid day off for employee’s birthday, paid year-end holiday shutdown, and 4 paid days off for personal wellness determined by Cisco</p></li><li><p>Non-exempt employees** receive 16 days of paid vacation time per full calendar year, accrued at rate of 4.92 hours per pay period for full-time employees</p></li><li><p>Exempt employees participate in Cisco’s flexible vacation time off program, which has no defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use (subject to availability and some business limitations)</p></li><li><p>80 hours of sick time off provided on hire date and each January 1st thereafter, and up to 80 hours of unused sick time carried forward from one calendar year to the next</p></li><li><p>Additional paid time away may be requested to deal with critical or emergency issues for family members</p></li><li><p>Optional 10 paid days per full calendar year to volunteer</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For non-sales roles, employees are also eligible to earn annual bonuses subject to Cisco’s policies.</p><p></p><p>Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components, subject to the applicable Cisco plan. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows:</p><ul><li><p>.75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;</p></li><li><p>1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;</p></li><li><p>1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and</p></li><li><p>Once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay 0% up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.</p><p></p><p>The applicable full salary ranges for this position, by specific state, are listed below:</p><p></p><p>New York City Metro Area:</p>$44,000.00 - $185,000.00<p>Non-Metro New York state & Washington state: </p>$44,000.00 - $185,000.00<p>* For quota-based sales roles on Cisco’s sales plan, the ranges provided in this posting include base pay and sales target incentive compensation combined.</p><p>** Employees in Illinois, whether exempt or non-exempt, will participate in a unique time off program to meet local requirements.</p>

RELOCATION ASSISTANCE: No relocation assistance available<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>CLEARANCE TYPE: None<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>TRAVEL: Yes, 10% of the Time<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h2><b>Description</b></h2><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p>Discover careers that change the world and further advancements in defense, technology, and engineering today at Northrop Grumman. Use your experience to grow your career and support our global customers with the technology, systems, and solutions they need to enable their missions on the front lines and secure our world every day. With Northrop Grumman, you’ll discover a culture built on diversity, respect, and above all teamwork. Together with our group of experts across the technical spectrum, you’ll discover opportunities to make a difference in our world and start solving some of the world’s most critical problems in the most innovative ways.</p><p></p><p>An internship at Northrop Grumman is unique. Sure, you’ll learn new skills, explore our enterprise, network with experts, connect with thought leaders, and finish with a resume that opens doors. But you’ll gain something even more valuable: pride in what you’ve done. Join us and launch your career. We’ll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of global security.</p><p></p><p><b>Northrop Grumman is seeking a Supply Chain intern for an internship opportunity.</b> This position will be located at our Defense Systems Sector in <b>Mesa, AZ</b>.</p><p></p><p>The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Armament Systems Business Unit</p><p></p><p><b>Basic Qualifications</b></p><p><b>A candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:</b></p><ul><li>Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university and will be enrolled full time in Fall 2026.</li></ul><ul><li>Be majoring in Supply Chain or related field.</li></ul><ul><li>Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during <b>summer 2026.</b></li></ul><ul><li>Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite) as well as Program Special access within a reasonable period of time, as determined by the company to meet its business needs (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite).</li><li>Have strong skills on MS Office Suite, Excel, Power Point.</li><li>Demonstrate excellent organization, verbal and written communication skills. </li></ul><p><b>Preferred Qualifications: </b></p><ul><li>Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher</li><li>Data analytics skills are a plus.</li></ul><p></p><p>At Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.</p><p></p><p></p><p>campusjobs</p><p></p>The application period for the job is estimated to be 20 days from the job posting date. However, this timeline may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>Northrop Grumman is an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO and pay transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for all positions with a government clearance and certain other restricted positions.

Job Description

Nice to meet you!

We’re the leader in data and AI. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence – and questions into answers.   

 

 If you’re looking for a dynamic, fulfilling career with flexibility and a world-class employee experience, you’ll find it here. We’re recognized around the world for our inclusive, meaningful culture and innovative technologies by organizations like Fast Company, Forbes, Newsweek and more.  

 

What you’ll do

Looking for *that* internship? The game-changing one that’ll help you learn, grow, and chart your path forward? You’ll find it at SAS. Our interns aren’t coffee runners – they do real, meaningful work. Our award-winning internship program is focused on development, culture, and community. We’ll help you grow professionally, find (or further) your passion, and make memorable connections that last beyond the summer.

The Strategic Programs and Operations team, in Corporate Operations & Planning (CO&P), leads high-impact, cross-divisional initiatives, programs and projects that drive strategic transformation and operational excellence across SAS. The team accelerates SAS’s strategic vision and transforms prioritized initiatives into measurable results through program alignment, governance, decision analytics, and business impact. Through disciplined execution, we strive to deliver on time, within scope, and with measurable value, fostering a culture of accountability and continuous improvement that drives long-term business success.

As an intern, you might: 
• Collaborate with Program Managers and Data Scientists to support delivery of programs, projects, and activities that advance SAS’s strategic goals and initiatives.
• Support and monitor schedules, timelines and/or program or project plans to effectively track and monitor progress.
• Attend meetings and working sessions with colleagues and team members to support management of deliverables and to monitor and report progress.
• Proactively manage action items and work items to resolve issues in partnership with stakeholders to maintain program or project delivery within defined scope and timelines.
• Build and modify work products such as documents, presentations, and/or spreadsheets to support business operations.

Required Qualifications 
• You are an undergraduate student studying Business Administration, Business Management, Communications, Project Management, or related degree; not graduating prior to December 2026. 
• You have experience with Microsoft 365, including Copilot or similar AI integration
• You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.
• Strong communication skills – both written and verbal.
• Leadership abilities. Your past experiences demonstrate you’ll take initiative and go above and beyond the call of duty.
• You’re interested in the future of Analytics and embrace technology

Preferred Qualifications 
• You have the ability to convey information and ideas clearly and concisely in a manner that helps yourself and others understand and retain information.
• You have the desire to manage action plans to complete work efficiently and on time according to priorities and timelines set in conjunction with your manager.
• You are willing, open and desire to learn about many divisions at SAS, and to learn new business operations skills including program and project skills, technologies and practices, and contribute to team collaboration and outputs.

Location
• Cary HQ/Hybrid

 

Timeline
• Applications open: February 2026 - Applications will open on a rolling basis
• Interviews begin: February 2026
• Internship: May 19, 2026 – August 7, 2026.

Perks of the job
• Work with (and learn from) the best. As a SAS intern, you’ll get face time with our top executives!
• Free SAS programming training and certification.
• At SAS, flexible work is the norm. Want to work remotely? That’s cool. Prefer a hybrid mix of sweatpants and in-person collaboration? That’s great, too.
• We work hard, but we like to play hard, too. Enjoy hackathons, social events and other opportunities to connect + engage.
• Your well-being matters, and that’s why we support all dimensions of your well-being by offering programs that reduce stress and distractions to help you stay healthy and productive. This includes an on-site and remote Work/Life Center staffed by master’s level social workers and an Employee Assistance Program.

Diverse and inclusive   

At SAS, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here.

Additional Information

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. SAS is an equal opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Know Your Rights. Also view the Pay Transparency notice.

Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.

SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. If you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, or on behalf of SAS, please contact Recruitingsupport@sas.com.

Pay Transparency: The hourly rate for SAS internships is determined by the applicant’s year in school and the position they are hired into. Hourly rates range from $15 – $30 for associate’s/bachelor’s level positions and $29 - $49/hour for master’s/Ph.D positions. Internship roles are not eligible for bonus.

Together, we make clean energy happen.Eligibility and benefits are governed by the terms of the applicable plan or program document which can be amended or terminated at any time.For more information, please visit Total Rewards | Williams Companies.Education Requirements:Skill Requirements:Career and Self-Development, Communication, Critical Thinking, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Professionalism, Teamwork, TechnologyCompetency Requirements:

We are DR Power, a Generac Company, professional power equipment done right.

Established in 1985, we are a leader in the design and manufacture of professional-grade gas and battery-powered outdoor power equipment. We are dedicated to the enduring quality and uncompromising performance of everything we build. We stand behind every DR® product and are here to help every customer regardless of when or where they made their initial purchase.

DR Power’s Engineering Intern position is responsible to work with other engineers to fulfill special design requests on our products. Under supervision of engineers, the intern will create definitions of parts and assemblies in the form of 2D cross sections, 3D models, tolerance stack-ups, and various electronic data formats to support analysis, manufacturing, assembly and service. Participants develop technical skills through challenging assignments and usage of technical tools.

This position is based onsite at our South Burlington, VT office.

Job Duties:

  • Designs, validates, and brings new products to market.

  • Provide new product development support in the Industrial, Commercial, Residential and/or Retail outdoor power equipment product area including; Creating and maintaining CAD models, drawings, and BOMs, Supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs), Interfacing with internal company personnel, Provide technical support for assigned projects.

  • Specifies precise new product functional requirements; designs, tests and integrates standard, less complex components to produce final designs; and evaluates the design's overall effectiveness, cost (including cost/benefit analysis), reliability (risk analysis), and safety.

  • Designs, develops, executes and evaluates fitness-for-use testing, product specifications and process validation plans for standard products and/or components; creates and reviews material part specifications and bills of materials.

  • Collaborates with internal manufacturing partners, designers and product specialists to optimize basic designs for manufacturability.

  • Utilizes CAD (Computer Aided Design) or CAE (Computer Aided Engineering) systems to model new designs and produce detailed engineering drawings.

  • Supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs)

  • Other duties as assigned.

Education, Skills & Experience:

  • Currently pursuing a BS degree (preferably in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering).

  • Available to work Summer 2026 between May and August for 40 hours per week.

  • Understanding or working knowledge of Pro-E and/or AutoCAD experience.

  • Microsoft Office experience (including Excel).

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.

“We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”

job_title: Security Consulting Engineer I (Intern) United States
job_description: <p>Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.</p><p></p><p></p><div><div><p><span><span>Applications are accepted until further notice. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Meet the Team </span></b><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><span><span>Cisco Security Customer Experience (CX) organization supports customers through the entire lifecycle of a security solution: from understanding business needs to deploying custom solutions, from </span><span>optimizing</span><span> existing solutions to developing applications that meets specific needs; from helping customers to </span><span>maintain</span><span> their solution</span></span><span><span>s to helping them investigate poten</span></span><span><span>tial security incidents. As a Security Consulting Engineer Intern, you will be able to interact with customers and learn how Cisco plan, design, deploy and </span><span>optimize</span><span> Security Solution while </span><span>acquiring</span><span> the technical and consultative skills </span><span>required</span><span> to accurately delight Cisco customers. During the internship you will also </span><span>have the opportunity to</span><span> interact with other Cisco organizations and learn how they contribute to </span><span>enable</span><span> our customers to achieve their business goals. </span></span><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your Impact </span></b><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><span><span>Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more relevant than ever. Our employees have groundbreaking ideas that impact everything imaginable - from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, smart cars, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means </span><span>you’ll</span><span> take creative ideas from the drawing board to powerful solutions that have real world impact. </span><span>You’ll</span><span> collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with expert mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. </span><span>You’ll</span><span> be part of a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and </span><span>you’ll</span><span> </span><span>participate</span><span> in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be inspired. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will attend on-site design and configuration sessions with a Security Consulting mentor </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will collect requirements from customers for projects to meet critical business goals </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will work with a team mentor to define the business goals and requirements for integration efforts </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will aid in analyzing and designing policy creation for Identity Services, Firewalls, Visibility </span><span>Solutions</span><span> and Cloud-based solutions. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will analyze customer configurations and provide feedback on </span><span>possible improvements</span><span> to the configuration to improve alignment with customer business goals </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will learn and understand Security Policies, Standards, Procedures and Guidelines </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will be able to </span><span>demonstrate</span><span> programming languages (Java/Python/C++) and </span><span>open source</span><span> automation platforms (Ansible/Chef/Terraform) to develop tailor-made automation capabilities to customers using Cisco application programming interfaces </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Minimum Qualifications </span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Currently enrolled in a certification program (e.g., Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College</span><span>), or</span><span> currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program. <p><b><b>WEX Inc.</b></b> is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. Our purpose is simple: to reduce administrative burdens, streamline payments, and manage mobility.</p><p></p><p>With a team of over 7,200 professionals across 16 countries. Our specialties are <b>employee benefits, business payments, and fleet/mobility solutions</b>. We support more than 20 million SaaS accounts, 8 million Health Savings Accounts, and 19+ million vehicles worldwide. Imagine starting your career with a company that’s building what's next. Your future starts here.</p><p></p><p><b>About the team/role:</b></p><p><span>WEX Bank is a leading provider of financial solutions and payment services. of defense (the business areas) compliance. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Learn how to assess the level of risk associated with any issues found during testing, following established guidelines. Strategy MBA Internship

Jumpstart your strategy career and make a business impact at the largest technology solutions company in the world. Dell Technologies is seeking best-in-class, out-of-the-box thinkers to influence our business and play a key strategic role. It’s an exciting time to make a difference, as Dell emerges as the only provider of integrated, end-to-end solutions from cloud to mobility to big data to security.

Join us as an MBA Strategy Intern on our Client Solutions Group in Austin, Texas to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve

As a Dell MBA Strategy intern, you will own a workstream of a strategic project that allows you to have a real impact on the business from day one. In your role you will work individually and within a project team to take on topics such as evaluating new product / business opportunities and identifying process and operational changes to improve business results.

You will:

  • Perform work aligned with your personal career goals and interests to solve complex problems

  • Develop relevant strategy skills that will help you launch a successful career

  • Join in networking opportunities with fellow MBA interns, alumni, and business leaders

  • Learn more about Dell’s career development and rotational programs that focus on building our top talent pipeline and nurturing future leaders

  • Participate in professional development trainings, community service activities, and various ‘showcase Austin’ social events throughout the summer

This internship will provide visibility into Dell’s broader organization while simultaneously allowing you to focus on a specific business unit that most closely aligns with your skills, interests, and career goals. You’ll have the opportunity to work in one of our Client Solutions areas such as:

  • Go-to-market (GTM) strategy for business units such as Consumer & Small Business, Commercial Sales, and Software & Peripherals (SnP)

  • Product portfolio strategy

  • Digital transformation

  • Innovation strategy

  • Expansion into new markets

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements

  • MBA Class of 2027

  • Prior work experience in an analytical or strategic role, or equivalent related experience when you join full-time

  • Very strong understanding of business strategies and drivers

Desirable Requirements

  • Demonstrated skills in fact-based analysis, presentation, and interpersonal interaction

  • Expert problem solving and quantitative analytical skills

Compensation

Dell is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this position is $45/hr- $57.50/hr.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

The opportunity

Delaware North is hiring a Intern to join our IT team in West Yellowstone, Montana.

 

Are you an undergraduate or graduate student seeking an internship in a fast-paced, inclusive environment with real-world learning opportunities? Delaware North internships are paid and can be completed for academic credit. Summer internship dates typically span 10-14 weeks between: May 2026 and August 2026. 

 

Student is responsible for travel to begin and end internship.  Housing is provided during the course of internship.

 

By participating in our internship program, you will gain valuable work experience, develop your leadership capabilities, and make an impact on the business. You will discover how a global hospitality company operates and work alongside exceptional team members who exemplify our values: Lean Forward, Come Together, Stand Up, Do Right, and Think Guest.

 

All Delaware North interns participate in the Delaware North Intern Experience which includes opportunities for hybrid and in-person work, executive and peer mentoring, and on-the-job learning.

 

Ready to help create the future of hospitality? Apply today to see why this internship is your best career move yet.

Pay

$17.00 - $20.00 / hour

Information on our comprehensive benefits package can be found at https://careers.delawarenorth.com/whatweoffer.

What we offer

We care about our team member’s personal and professional well-being. Delaware North provides a benefits package designed to give you the comfort, safety, and security you need to deliver exceptional experiences for our guests. All team members receive benefits including:

  • Weekly pay
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Employee discounts
  • Flexible work schedules

Eligible team members may also receive: health, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid vacation days and holidays, paid parental bonding leave, employee assistance program, and tuition and/or professional certification reimbursement.

What will you do?

  • Provide technical support for all computer systems on the property, including configuration, installation, and maintenance of concessions point of sale systems and troubleshooting of TCP/IP, LAN/WAN, Android OS, Windows OS, and network equipment.
  • Assist with day-to-day IT support requests and ticket resolution.
  • Set up and maintain PCs, laptops, printers, and other peripherals for end users, as well as terminating and running low voltage cables (Cat5e/Cat6).
  • Provide application support for point of sale systems and Global Payments.
  • Maintain digital signage throughout the property.
  • Help document systems, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
  • Perform basic troubleshooting across hardware, software, and network layers.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain end user devices and operational systems.
  • Navigate and support enterprise platforms.

More about you

  • Pursuing a Degree: Bachelor’s.
  • Area of Study: IT, CIS, MIS, Computer Science.
  • Familiarity with Windows OS and basic familiarity with the OSI model.
  • Strong communication, time management, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Understand how enterprise IT systems support real business operations in hospitality and retail environments.
  • Communicate effectively with technical teams and non-technical staff.

Physical requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs, climb ladders, and stand or walk for extended periods.

Shift details

Days
8hr shift

Who we are

Our business is all about people, and that includes you. At Delaware North, you’re not just part of a team — you’re part of a global legacy: a family-owned company with 100+ years of history behind it. Our operations span the world, offering you unique paths to growth and success.

Who says you can’t love where you work? With jobs in iconic sports arenas, stunning national parks, exciting casinos, and more, we pride ourselves on giving the world great times in great places. And whether you’re interested in restaurants, hotels, sports, gaming, operations, or retail, part-time or full-time, we’re invested in helping you achieve your career goals.

Together, we’re shaping the future of hospitality — come grow with us!

Delaware North, along with its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer, showcasing job opportunities and considering applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status.

Job DescriptionAbout the Role

Uber's Strategic Finance team is uniquely positioned to have transparency into Uber's overall global business and to use financial & operational data to reach insights others might not be able to make. The team is responsible for working closely with cross-functional teams to support financial planning, tracking key financial metrics, driving efficiency, and making product and business recommendations.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to support one of our high growth businesses and use insights to help Uber prioritize initiatives and reach conclusions. As part of the summer program, your deliverable will be a business recommendation to the Strategic Finance Leadership team. This position is based in our San Francisco headquarters.

Pro Tip: Apply early-roles may close sooner than expected due to high demand.

What You'll Do
• Financial Planning: be part of the team that is responsible for financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis for Uber's global business
• Strategic Thinking: Apply business judgment and financial insights to assist with decision making related to new initiatives, products, and business opportunities
• Financial Modeling: Build intricate financial models from scratch, improve existing models, and break complex models down into component parts
• Operational Excellence: Lead initiatives that help us scale from startup to enterprise
Basic Qualifications
• Currently enrolled in a BS/BA program in Finance, Accounting, Economics or a similar field (graduation date Winter 2026 - Spring 2027)
• Basic knowledge of GAAP and experience with Excel/gSheets
• Minimum 1 year of involvement in extracurricular groups, activities, or internship opportunities
Preferred Qualifications
• Prior analytical internship experience in the technology industry, including FP&A, investment banking, management consulting or private equity
• Leadership positions in any extracurricular activities
• Proven understanding of GAAP, enterprise-level financial planning systems, SQL, and/or statistical software packages
• Outstanding analytical skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Ability to structure effective presentations
• Attention to detail and ability to execute in a fast paced environment
• Self-starter - you take initiative, set goals, and meet them
About the Team

We are a global and expansive team that excels at combining strategy and real numbers. We are leaders helping to set the financial and strategic direction of the company.

We are embedded in all the global businesses and functions of Uber, setting the financial plans and operating cadence. However, our work really begins when the plans are set. We proactively connect the dots, set the course, and help the company deliver on its goals!

We also don't just say how it is. We are members of the team that finds and implements the solutions to our biggest challenges.
About Uber

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at the least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base hourly rate amount for this role is USD$35.00 per hour.

You will also be eligible for various benefits.
Employment Type: OTHER

Lockheed Martin Space is seeking a Summer 2026 Intern as a Supply Chain Material Cost Estimator Intern. In this role, you will work with proposal teams to produce material estimates. This includes, but is not limited to, collaborating with engineering on material requirements, obtaining price information via historical system data and/or new quotations, and supporting system architecture efforts.

The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of supply chain management, finance, and proposals.

Must be a US Citizen.

Represented full time employees accrue 6.67 hours of Vacation per month; accrue up to 52 hours of sick leave annually; receive at least 96 hours for holidays. PTO, Vacation, sick leave, and holiday hours are prorated based on start date during the calendar year.
Lockheed Martin is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified candidates will be considered without regard to legally protected characteristics.

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>Health is everything. able to stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Precision control: able to adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Visual Acuity: Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Able to orally communicate information and instructions to colleagues and customers</li><li>Occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs; As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 02/07/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

job_title: 2026 Summer Intern & Co-Op: Chemical, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering Opportunities
job_description: <div><div><p></p><p><span><span>At <b>DuPont</b>, our paid internship and co-op opportunities are designed to give students more than just a glimpse into the professional world—they’re a launchpad for your future. You’ll work on real, impactful projects alongside experienced DuPont professionals, applying what you’ve learned in the classroom to solve real-world challenges. Through this hands-on experience, you’ll build essential skills, grow your network, and gain exposure to a collaborative, inclusive workplace that values innovation and leadership. You will have the opportunity to collaborate across teams and functions, gaining exposure to innovative technologies and diverse perspectives that drive real-world solutions.</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span><span>As an Engineering intern or co-op, you’ll:</span></span><span> </span></b></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Embrace DuPont’s core values in safety, sustainability, and innovation</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Gain industrial experience and insight into our businesses, products, and customers</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Work in team-based environments with mentorship and technical training</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Participate in professional development opportunities tailored to your role</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Our student program offers both internships and co-op assignments tailored to fit your academic schedule and career goals. Assignment length and scope may vary by site and function, but every experience is designed to help you grow, contribute, and lead. Typical roles in manufacturing, operations, and business at DuPont span a wide range of exciting and impactful areas, including Manufacturing Technical and Process Engineering, Capital Projects, Automation and Process Control, Leveraged Engineering, Equipment Reliability and Maintenance, Continuous Improvement, Product Quality, and Technical Service. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span>Summer interns and co-ops must be available from May – August. </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><u><span>Requirements</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>To be considered, the following requirements must be met:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>Enrolled as a full-time student pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical, Mechanical, Electrical or other engineering disciplines from an ABET accredited program <span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>GPA of 3.0 or higher (out of 4.0 scale)</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Legal right to work in the U.S. without restriction</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><p style="text-align:left">At DuPont, our purpose is to empower the world with essential innovations to thrive. We work on things that matter. Whether it’s providing clean water to more than a billion people on the planet, producing materials that are essential in everyday technology devices from smartphones to electric vehicles, or protecting workers around the world. Discover the many reasons the world’s most talented people are choosing to work at DuPont. <a href="https://careers.dupont.com/us/en/whyjoinus" target="_blank">Why Join Us | DuPont Careers</a></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our<span> </span></span><a href="http://www.dupont.com/global-links/accessibility.html" target="_blank">Accessibility Page for Contact Information</a><span>.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p>The Pay range for this role is $16.10 - $25.30 Hourly<p></p><p><b>How Base Pay is Determined:</b> DuPont has job leveling frameworks that help organize roles based on progressive levels of responsibility, proficiency and qualifications. Each role has an associated pay range (or an established pay rate for some roles) based on the competitive market in each country where we operate. Each individual’s pay is based on a variety of factors, including their role and the associated pay range for that role, their geographic location (i.e., country, state, metropolitan area), as well as their skills, experience, education and certifications, and performance.</p></p>

<p><b><b>WEX Inc.</b></b><span> is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. Our purpose is simple: to reduce administrative burdens, streamline payments, and manage mobility.</span></p><p></p><p><span>With a team of over 7,200 professionals across 16 countries. Our specialties are<b> </b></span><b>employee benefits, business payments, and fleet/mobility solutions</b><span>. We support more than 20 million SaaS accounts, 8 million Health Savings Accounts, and 19+ million vehicles worldwide. We're a growing company with a history of innovation and a focus on our customers, making this a great place to grow your career.</span></p><p></p><p><b>The WEX Summer Internship Program: Learn, Lead, and Make an Impact</b></p><p><span>Our 13-week paid internship program, running from late May to mid-August, is a chance for you to gain real-world experience and develop your skills. Recruiting begins in January and continues through March at our various locations across the U.S.</span></p><p></p><p><span>You won't just be a bystander; you'll work on impactful projects and contribute to WEX’s mission. We provide mentorship, professional development, and weekly learning experiences to help you build confidence and leadership skills. High-performing interns may even get the chance to lead their own initiatives.</span></p><p></p><p><span>We offer remote, hybrid, and onsite options for flexibility, and our goal is to bring top interns back full-time or offer them extended roles during the school year. Imagine starting your career with a company that’s building what's next. Your future starts here.</span></p><p></p><p><b>About the team/role:</b></p><p>Global Third Party Risk Management (GTPRM) ensures that risks introduced by third-party relationships are identified, assessed, and managed throughout the vendor lifecycle in alignment with regulatory requirements and the company’s risk tolerance.</p><p></p><p><b>How you'll make an impact:</b></p><ul><li><p><span>Providing support to the Vendor Management Team in the assessment of vendor risks.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Resolving the backlog of domestic and international vendors to ensure compliance with WEX Regulatory requirements.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Performing data entry for vendor due diligence analytics.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Promoting operational enhancements through targeted project-based assignments.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Reviewing submitted materials for potential deficiencies and associated risks.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Completing outstanding due diligence for established vendors.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Validating the accuracy of vendor metadata.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Organizing and monitoring the status of due diligence documentation.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Actively lead internal projects around vendor management process improvements.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Work closely with multiple lines of the business and bring strategic visions to key initiatives.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Learn and operate within WEX’s P2P and TPRM tools.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Monitor data for relevant risk changes with the tool and escalate as needed.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p>You should also expect:</p><ul><li><p><span>A collaborative and challenging working environment.</span></p></li><li><p><span>The opportunity to engage with various stakeholders across the business and senior leadership teams.</span></p></li><li><p><span>To train and develop your skills in your area of work with some of the best experts in the payment industry.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Experience you'll bring:</b></p><ul><li><p>At a minimum, you should be a rising Junior or Senior Bachelor's student, in a degree/certificate-seeking accredited program.</p></li><li><p>Strong time management skills, including planning and execution.</p></li><li><p>Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting information.</p></li><li><p>Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.</p></li><li><p>Strong interpersonal and communication skills.</p></li><li><p>Ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment, and a willingness to try new things.</p></li><li><p>Ability to work effectively under limited supervision. </p></li><li><p>Experience with Excel and/or Google Sheets is a must.</p></li></ul><p></p><p></p>The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. Actual pay rates will vary and will be based on various factors, such as your qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. Base pay is one component of WEX's total compensation package. Most sales positions are eligible for commission under the terms of an applicable plan. Non-sales roles are typically eligible for a quarterly or annual bonus based on their role and applicable plan. WEX's comprehensive and market competitive benefits are designed to support your personal and professional well-being. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurances, retirement savings plan, paid time off, health savings account, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, and more. For more information, check out the "About Us" section.<p></p><p></p>Pay Range: $20.00 - $25.00

Our purpose is simple: to reduce administrative burdens, streamline payments, and manage mobility.</span></p><p></p><p><span>With a team of over 7,200 professionals across 16 countries. Our specialties are <b>employee benefits, business payments, and fleet/mobility solutions</b>. We support more than 20 million SaaS accounts, 8 million Health Savings Accounts, and 19+ million vehicles worldwide. We're a growing company with a history of innovation and a focus on our customers, making this a great place to grow your career.</span></p><p></p><p><span><b>The WEX Summer Internship Program: Learn, Lead, and Make an Impact</b><br />Our 13-week paid internship program, running from late May to mid-August, is a chance for you to gain real-world experience and develop your skills. High-performing interns may even get the chance to lead their own initiatives.</span></p><p></p><p><span>We offer remote, hybrid, and onsite options for flexibility, and our goal is to bring top interns back full-time or offer them extended roles during the school year. Imagine starting your career with a company that’s building what's next. Your future starts here.</span></p><p></p><p><b><b>About the team/role:</b></b></p><p><span>You will work with WEX merchants on Fuel Related Products. Auditing fuel discounts and merchant set-up. You will primarily work with internal WEX employees, assisting with improving processes and procedures. </span></p><p></p><p><b><b>How you'll make an impact:</b></b></p><ul><li><p><span>Understand fintech marketplace for new entrants trying to enter into commercial diesel fueling space.</span></p></li><li><p><span>With existing players in the space document features and functionality, identify new features and potential offerings in their respective experience.</span></p></li><li><p><span>For disrupters, catalog price offering to users and compare to internal WEX offering by market/zip/city and state/lane; this will be an ongoing documentation effort to understand pricing strategy and promotions for new users.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Intern will sign up for communications and notifications from fintech apps to understand targeted marketing approach.</span></p></li><li><p><span>​Assist with reconciliation of pre-auth vs post-auth to identify outstanding transactions that need a force post.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Contribute to Fuel Management operations for setting up of discounts for partner and asset based carrier price feeds Updating of cost components and freight rates, addition of new locations into Fuel Management database for use in application and in price file feeds; coordinate tax updates at federal, state, local levels on monthly/quarterly/annual basis.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Support of sftp migration for existing feeds.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Provide support for: Account implementation for SaaS accounts. Make educated decisions on pricing moves and use tool to push updates to Redis for use in application.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Facilitate and document features and functionality for potential rewrite into an angular front end supported by OTR (Over-The-Road) tech stack (will allow SSO).</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><b>Experience you'll bring:</b></b></p><ul><li><p><span>At a minimum, you should be a rising Junior or Senior Bachelor's student, in a degree/certificate-seeking accredited program.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong time management skills, including planning and execution.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting information.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong interpersonal and communication skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment, and a willingness to try new things.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work effectively under limited supervision. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Excel and Tableau Skills are a must.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Finance background, fluent in apps and social media, current on technology trends and direction within vertical are plus.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p></p><p></p>The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. <p>Northrop Grumman is a space pioneer, supporting government, civil and commercial customers in solving their biggest challenges.
